posts.author: Arkanis Gath
posts.content:
Under the guise of Nakasr and in the form that most of his avatars took, Jergal appeared as a member of an ancient alien race that resembled a cross between a humanoid and praying mantis. He was a wizened and insubstantial creature, mummy-like in appearance with gray, tightly taut skin. His elongated skull hosted bulbous, yellow eyes devoid of life and insectoid mandibles, as well as a nose and ears barely distinguishable from the rest of his head. His lengthy, claw-like hands and forearms were covered by a pair of white gloves, clutching a quill with fresh ink and a thick scroll covered in an intricate and incomprehensible script.

After a quick braistorming on Build Request/Unfinalized Builds my dude is finally ready for publication.
I should thank @Mick Dagger , @Stagmeister , @TheSquid  and @Maximillian_Kane  for their support and advices.
The build comes from the concept of getting the most out of the spells Harm and Heal offensively, and it is based on a famous previous one by Mithdradates: 
Hierophant of Velsharoon

Strategies:
Just fill up your spellbook of Harm (6th level) and Silent Harm (7th level), than go around (maybe in Extended Greater Sanctuary, but not necessary) and touch all the living things with Harm, and Heal the dead. That wouldn't finish them, it would leave them with 1d4 hp but you have your other hands for that.

Notes:
This build does not work on servers that have nerfed Harm and Heal ofc.
This build suffers, like many others, the presence of Spell Mantles, you will need to find as many breach scrolls as possible (dunno if you can dispel Mantles)

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Without wishing to be a party-pooper, @Arkanis Gath , have you fully tested this build? Any builds in this section have to be tested all the way through (if you haven't seen them, you can read the rules via a link in the leading post on this forum), so that those wishing to use them have confidence in their integrity, together with any issues that might befall the build at its various stages (for example, how to survive before Heal and Harm become available). Please let me know, or I'll have to move it back to the Unfinalized section until you have.

Your enthusiasm is to be applauded, though!

Cheers
